data.title: [WIP] Add button to hide resource previews
data.body:
fixes #6542 (but not the lag problem mentioned in the discussion).

Since Juan is currently reworking the resources, it seems most don't currently have previews, so it's currently only implemented for textures.

There's also some room for improvements, but since this is my first serious pull request, and I'm not exactly comfortable working in C++, I thought I'd make sure I'm on the right track before tackling any more.

data.title: Fix issues with set_window_resizable on x11
data.body: This fixes issue #6572 and also fixes set_window_size not working when set_window_resizable(false) was used before.

data.title: animation player signals
data.body:
I'm opening this because the v3 API changes issue is close... or I don't know which one is currently open.

The `AnimationPlayer` node has these signals:

- `animation_changed(String old_name, String new_name)`
- `animation_started(String name)`
- `finished()`

When auto generating functions for these signals through the GUI we'd end up with names like `_on_AnimationPlayer_animation_started` etc. Kind of an overkill. I propose these be changed in v3 to:

- `changed(String old_name, String new_name)`
- `started(String name)`
- `finished(String name)` <- also include info on which animation finished playing
- `finished_all()` <- as per @bebae's comment in #7444. I didn't know that `finished` is emitted after ALL animations are finished playing. So basically the old `finished` would become `finished_all` or something like that and the new `finished(String name)` will behave as `started(String name)`

data.title: corrected ClassDB::instance() return type
data.body: The return type was `void` which is wrong, it's Variant. This caused some confusion on my part and the generated bindings for the WIP dlscript module have errors because of this.

data.title: grammar fixes, it's -> its
data.body: Fixed these in the docs, but since some of the docs are autogenerated from this xml, we need them here too (thanks akien-mga).

data.title: Word wrap makes label unreadable when put in VBoxContainer
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1.1 and 2.1.2, Windows 10 64 bits

What I did:
Create a VBoxContainer, and add a few labels in it, all of them with some text. Enable word wrapping (auto-wrap) on one of them.

What happened:
The label shrunk to a height of 1, making the text unreadable. It can be resized but it overlaps on the following labels.

What was expected:
Be able to see the text, and have the label increase in height if word wrap makes it create visual line breaks so it push next items down (related to https://godotengine.org/qa/11957/how-can-set-label-change-size-according-the-length-of-the-text)

Screenshot:
![godot_label_wordwrap_vbox](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/22410407/ff0b4a62-e697-11e6-8525-d5d86118ada8.png)

data.title: Fix crash when saving root node by "Save Branch as Scene" with unsaved scene
data.body:
Fix #7667 

"Save Branch as Scene" for root node is not allowed already.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/6ab023fab552dbba19787da4c4ccb904022644d3/tools/editor/scene_tree_dock.cpp#L1596-L1599

But this only works with saved scene.
This PR is for 2.1
I will make another PR for master if it's OK.

data.title: Possible fix for #7676: linux hosts w. disabled ipv6 could not connect to asset lib.
data.body:
Linux hosts with disabled ipv6 could not connect to the asset lib due to incorrect IP::TYPE_ANY processing.

Added a simple ipv6 availability checker and updated socket domain selection logic.

data.title: Asset lib or Templates are not accessible on the hosts with disabled ipv6.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
GNU/Linux Debian 8.6 jessie
Godot: 2.1.2 stable/custom build

**Issue description:**
Asset lib from within the editor and Templates from project list are not accessible on the hosts with disabled ipv6 ( "Can't connect to host:  https://godotengine.org/asset-library/api" )

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. disable ipv6 on your machine
2. launch godot editor with -d flag
3. try to open 'templates' tab in the project selector
OR
open any project for editing and navigate to asset lib
4. see the "Can't connect to host: https://godotengine.org/asset-library/api

and the corresponding console log:
```
ERROR: _socket_create: Condition ' sockfd == -1 ' is true. returned: -1
   At: ./drivers/unix/socket_helpers.h:73.
ERROR: connect: Socket creation failed!
   At: drivers/unix/stream_peer_tcp_posix.cpp:148.
ERROR: _socket_create: Condition ' sockfd == -1 ' is true. returned: -1
   At: ./drivers/unix/socket_helpers.h:73.
ERROR: connect: Socket creation failed!
   At: drivers/unix/stream_peer_tcp_posix.cpp:148.
```

data.title: HTML5 mouse doesn't lock
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Arch Linux x86_64, but using web, godot 2.1.2


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Mouse look is meant to work, and it doesn't when using web.
Mouse cursor capture is not locked in WebGL, making it impossible to capture the cursor.
Additionally. y 0 is either at the top or above the top of the screen, making it impossible to look up (currently)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set up a kinematic controller, add a collider
Attach a camera to the kinematic body as a child, leave default name
Add a floor with collision (I used static body)
Use https://hastebin.com/ividaqayuf.cs as the script for the kinematicbody
Export for web

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:
Live demo: https://silvea12.keybase.pub/mousebug/horse.html

data.title: Nodes shouldn't be added to 'idle_process' group
data.body: I don't know if this is a new thing in v2.1.2, but I just noticed that nodes are added to this 'idle_process' group internally. This is a flaw in the design. Only groups added by the developer should be present at run time. If you add a node to only one group then you expect that the node will have only one group at run time and might think to retrieve that with `self.get_groups()[0]` or something like that. Because godot internally adds some nodes to 'idle_process', the above action can lead to errors.

data.title: A little fix in the italian traslation
data.body: Modified the "Please Confirm ..." which was translated in Italian with "Si Prega di Confermare..." (which is also wrong because it would be translated "You Pray to Confirm...") creating problems (the word came out from the box). In its place I put a "Per Favore Conferma..." That keeps the same meaning but should not create that little problem.

data.title: Morphs and skeletons do not work together
data.body: **Operating system or device - Godot version:** Godot_v2.1.2-stable_win64.exe - Windows7 64bit **Issue description:** Morphs and animations sometimes stop working. Blender Import to Godot engine (Morph does not work) **Steps to reproduce:** Import 3D models that have both morphs and skeletons. When there is morph and skeleton, It occurs. When there is only morph, this problem does **not** occur. When there is only a skeleton, this problem does **not** occur. When the number of morphs is small, this problem does **not** occur. Sorry for my bad english. Thank you. **Link to minimal example project:** https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_beyBEMhqIHazdRRkdWT3I2WHc/view?usp=sharing (Including 3D models) (In the Blender, skeleton = bone, morph = shape key)

data.title: Save Branch as Scene on edited scene causes a crash
data.body:
Operating system or device - Godot version: Linux - v2.1.1.stable.official (also tested with most recent Github version)

Creating a new unsaved scene, adding a Node (tested with Node2D) and attempting to save the scene using "Save Branch as Scene" results in an editor crash with error:

ERROR: set_owner: Condition ' !owner_valid ' is true.
   At: scene/main/node.cpp:1115.

(scene/main/node.cpp:1855 in Github build)

I'm not sure what the desired behaviour for this case would be, or if the user should see an error message informing them of the correct way to save the scene, as currently it is not very beginner friendly. As shown by this Reddit thread where somebody was running into this issue: https://www.reddit.com/r/godot/comments/5qq0j8/help_godot_crashes_when_saving_new_scene/

data.title: Fixed line lenght guideline, and added colour option
data.body: Fixed line length guideline drawing behind everything. Now draws in front, apart from the auto completion box. Also added an option to change its colour.

data.title: PathFollow2D gets set to 0  when unit_offset is set to 1
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64 - 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
~~When animating the unit_offset of a PathFollow2D, the follower always jumps back to position 0 when reaching a key with position 1. The value is shown correctly, however. It doesn't seem to happen with other properties that have a range from 0 to 1 (like opacity) so it seems to be a PathFollow2D issue.~~
It actually  always happens when the unit_offset is set to 1, by animation or not.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a PAth2D. Make a PathFollow2D as a child. Draw path. 
Make an animation player. Make a key for unit_offset of PathFollow2D. Set it to 0. Make another one, set it to 1. Start the animation and look at the follower.

data.title: Connections made in the editor replicate in inherited scenes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64 - 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
When using inherited scenes, connecting signals in the editor in a parent scene causes the connection also show up in a inherited scene when it is opened in the editor. When saved, the connection is stored as a different connection. That causes the "already connected" error when instancing the inherited scene, since the connection is made twice (or even more times when you have nested multiple inherited scenes). So you always need to delete the unneccesary connection before saving when you edit one of those (or connect in a script).


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a scene. make a connection within it. Save.
Create a inherited scene. The connection is already shown. Save.
Create a third scene, instance the inherited scene. Run. Look at the debugger.


I would recommend that the inherited connections are still shown within the inherited scene, but aren't stored separately and cannot be disconnected from there (like it works with groups).

data.title: Using a variable in range crashes Godot
data.body:
Using a variable in range crashes Godot.
```
for s in range(0,["1","2"].size()):
   print(s)
```

```
var a = ["1","2"].size()
for s in range(0,a):
   print(s)
```

```
var a = ["1","2"]
for s in range(0,a.size()):
   print(s)
```

```
var a = ["1","2"].size()
for s in range(a):
   print(s)
```

Error
tools.64 ERROR: operator[]: Condition ' p_index<0 || p_index>=size() ' is true. returned: aux
   At: core/vector.h:133.

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
x11
3.0 Master

data.title: Fixes #7630  Editor Translation Import Crash fix
data.body: Hint was appending for every language.  Modified to only create a hint on the matching language.

data.title: Feature request : Custom rotation amounts with path2d
data.body: Feature request : When you place control points for a path 2d it would be handy to be able to be able to set the rotation for each control point and have the rotation of the attached node interpolated accordingly as the object follows the path.

data.title: Want to check out the code
Feature request: string.join(".")
data.body:
**Feature request:**
Want method `StringArray.join(".")`
Like a PHP implode: http://php.net/manual/en/function.implode.php

**example:**
Usage:
```
    var splitted = ["mpv", "open", "dvd"]
    var joined = splitted.join(".")
    print(joined)
```

Output:
```
    "mpv.open.dvd"

```
